article.headline: New Hampshire 69, Brown 56
article.story: PROVIDENCE, R.I. -- Alvin Abreu had 18 points, including going 3 of 5 from 3-point range, to lead four double-figure scorers for New Hampshire in a 69-56 win over Brown on Wednesday night. Chandler Rhoads added 16 points, Patrick Konan 11 and Ferg Myrick 10 for the Wildcats (3-3). Each player that scored in double figures knocked down at least one 3-pointer for the Wildcats, who finished 8 of 18 (44.4 percent) from long range. Brown shot just 3 of 14 (21.4 percent) from beyond the arc. The Wildcats never trailed in a contest that was close the entire way until they broke off a 22-10 run in the game's final 7 minutes. New Hampshire outrebounded Brown 42-26 and outshot the Bears 46.9 percent (23 of 49) from the floor to just 36.5 percent (19 of 52). Sean McGonagill scored 15 points to lead the Bears (4-7).

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
